intro: Hieracium chloropsis subsp. apuanorum, commonly known as the Apuanum hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, yellowish-green composite flowers. This subspecies is native to the Apuan Alps in Tuscany, Italy, where it thrives in calcareous soils. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare member of the Hieracium genus.
